article_title: Women Surgeons Paid Less Than Men? The General Surgery News Report
article_text:
Does income inequality exist in surgery? General Surgery News explores whether male surgeons make more than their female peers.

Surgeons may experience deep emotional anguish when their patients suffer an adverse event. Several surgeons tell their stories.

A controversial new analysis found that surgical residents with more flexible schedules that allow them to work longer hours do not have worse outcomes and, in fact, often report benefits, such as improved continuity of care. Here's an editorial commenting on the study as well.

One general surgeon explores the supply and demand economics of the Affordable Care Act.

A new strategy, called mesh suture, may reduce the incidence of incisional hernias. Here's a video that explains the technique.

The General Surgery News Report is brought to MedPage Today readers by our friends at General Surgery News, a McMahon Group title. Free registration required for some articles.
